questions.question: If a business made a $1,000 sale on account, what would the general journal entries be?

choices.answer: debit sales and credit accounts payable
debit accounts payable and credit sales
debit accounts receivable and credit sales

questions.question: What is NOT a format rule for general journal entries?

choices.answer: Debit dollar amounts are placed in the left column.

questions.question: The matching principle requires businesses to:

choices.answer: record expenses in the same time period they are used to support revenue.
identify inventory from the same manufacture.

questions.question: If a business had $2,000 in supplies at the beginning of the month and $900 at end, what journal entries?

choices.answer: debit supplies and credit supplies expense.
debit supplies expense and credit supplies

questions.question: How do businesses maintain a formal record of financial transactions?
How does a company calculate net profit?

choices.answer: Total up all money owed to the business.
Subtract total expenses from total sales.

questions.question: Not recording the amount of supplies used at the end of the month would:

choices.answer: Overstate net income for the  month.
The fraction off the sale price
The discount terms to pay early or on time
Days of the month to expect delivery
The various quantities of product purchased

questions.question: What is the largest risk of a business selling its products or services on account?

choices.answer: Not having enough staff scheduled to work
